__data__.text:
A: A Data Centre is a facility used to house computer systems and associated
components, such as telecommunications and storage systems.
Q. What is a Data Centre?
Data Centre/Colocation FAQs
A: Colocation refers to the practice of renting space in a Data Centre to store and
maintain computer hardware and systems.
Q. What is Colocation?
A: Data Centre/Colocation solutions offer enhanced security, reliable uptime, scalability,
optimal environmental conditions, fast connectivity, and cost-effectiveness, as well as
expert support and amenities.
Q. Why should I use a Data Centre/Colocation solution?
A: Our state-of-the-art security measures include video surveillance, swipe card access
to your dedicated space, and redundant systems to protect against physical and cyber
threats.
Q. What security measures are in place to protect my data and systems?
1.866.765.2269
A: We offer multiple high-speed Internet connections, POTS (plain old telephone service),
redundant switching, and multiple Fibre optic connections with diverse paths from the
colo facility for increased network reliability.
Q. What connectivity options are available?
A: Our Data Centre provides easy access, free parking, 24/7 fob control, workstations,
and restroom facilities on-site.
Q. What amenities are available?
execulink.ca/data-centre

A: Our Colocation solutions are scalable for growing businesses, allowing you to easily add
or upgrade hardware to meet your changing needs as your business grows.
Q. How scalable is the solution?
A: Our redundant systems and backup power generators ensure your hardware and
systems are always available and functioning properly, providing reliable uptime.
Q. How reliable is the uptime?
A: Our in-house experts assist with hardware installation, maintenance, and
troubleshooting, providing expert support and saving you time and resources.
Q. What support options are available?
A: Renting rack space can be more cost-effective than building and maintaining your own
data centre, saving you money on infrastructure costs.
Q. How cost-effective is colocation compared to building and maintaining my own
Data Centre?
1.866.765.2269
A: Our Data Centre solutions are designed to accommodate a wide range of hardware,
including servers, storage devices, networking equipment, and more. Our team can work
with you to determine the best solution for your specific needs.
Q. What kind of hardware can I store in a Data Centre?
A: Our team of experts can provide assistance with hardware installation, maintenance,
and troubleshooting. We offer both remote and on-site support options to help ensure
your hardware is functioning properly and to minimize downtime.
Q. What kind of support do you offer for hardware installation and maintenance?
A: We offer swipe card access to your dedicated space, which allows you to physically
access your hardware and systems. We also offer remote access options, including secure
VPN and TLS connections, to allow you to access your systems from anywhere.
Q. How do I access my hardware and systems in the Data Centre?
A: Yes, we offer customizable colocation solutions to meet your specific needs. From
quarter, half, and full rack space options to customized power and cooling options, we can
work with you to design a solution that fits your unique requirements.
Q. Can I customize my colocation solution?
execulink.ca/data-centre

execulink.ca/data-centre
A: We use redundant systems and backup power generators to ensure reliable uptime.
This means that even in the event of a power outage or other disruption, your hardware
and systems will remain available and functioning properly.
Q. How do you ensure reliable uptime?
A: We offer multiple high-speed internet connections, including both shared and
dedicated options, to ensure fast and reliable connectivity. We also offer a range of
network connectivity solutions, including TLS, IP VPN, MPLS, and Private WAN, to help
you achieve your connectivity goals.
Q. How do you ensure fast and reliable connectivity?
A: Simply contact us to speak with one of our experts about your needs and
requirements. We can provide a consultation and work with you to design a customized
solution that meets your needs and fits your budget.
Q. How do I get started with your Data Centre/Colocation solutions?
A: Our Data Centre maintains optimal temperature and humidity levels with redundant
HVAC systems, raised floor applications, and fire suppression systems. This helps to
ensure your hardware is functioning properly and to minimize the risk of hardware failure.
Q. What kind of environmental controls are in place to ensure my hardware is
functioning properly?
